roleset.name: help, aid
roleset.note: HELP-V NOTES: Member of Vncls help-72-1. Updated by Julia, 10/2010. (from help.01-v)
HELP-N NOTES: Updated by Julia. Member of Vncls help-72-1. (from help.01-n)

role.descr: benefactive, secondary agent (when separate from arg1)

example.name: sentential argument
example.text: [Japanese money]-1 will help *trace*-1 turn SE Asia into a more cohesive economic region.
example.arg: *trace* turn SE Asia into a more cohesive economic region.

example.name: arg1 that seems like a benefactive, but is still arg1
example.text: She-1 was out *trace*-1 to help the poor underpriviledged child.

example.name: passivized
example.text: The stocks of banking concerns weren't helped much by the announcement.

example.name: with benefactive
example.text: Mary helped John with his homework.

example.name: another transitive
example.text: You'll be helping a neighborhood S& L in areas crucial to its survival.
example.arg: in areas crucial to its survival

example.name: both arg1 and 2 in the same node
example.text: [Computer makers]-1 were scrambling *trace*-1 to help customers recover from the disaster .

example.name: autogen1
example.text: Traders worked with the help of sunlight streaming throughwindows

example.name: autogen2
example.text: they need help to restrain their darker compulsions

roleset.name: avoid
roleset.note: HELP-V NOTES: No appropriate VN class for this sense. (from help.02-v)

example.name: can't help
example.text: He sometimes can't help * exclaiming in frustration.

example.name: can't help but..
example.text: I can't help but wonder why.

roleset.name: help, aid
roleset.note: HELP_OUT-V NOTES: No Vncls specifically for the VPC, but see help-72-1. (from help.03-v)

example.name: infinitival
example.text: Her mother would call her-1 to her side *-1 to help out.

roleset.name: tending to, able to provide assistance
roleset.note: HELPFUL-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on WSJ. Corresponds to VNcls help-72-1. (from helpful.01-j)

example.name: all args
example.text: Judging from their reaction, the book was helpful to them in understanding schizophrenia.
